item.title: Theory: Evolutionary Game Theory
item.description: [WARNING] Citeproc: citation Hofbauer1979 not found Consider a two player symmetric \(m × m\) game with \(\ALPHABET A_1 = \ALPHABET A_2 = \ALPHABET B := \{1, \dots, m \}\). Let \[ Δ^m = \bigl\{ (p_1, \dots, p_m) : \sum_{i=1}^m p_i = 1 \text{ and } p_i \in [0, 1] \bigr\}. \] denote the set of mixed strategies. We will use \(p = (p_1, \dots, p_m)\) (instead of \(α\) used earlier) to denote a mixed strategy.
